title: Designing Faculty Training Programs Based on Scientific Inquiry for Supporting Students with Disabilities

context.prior_knowledge: Basic educational methodologies, elementary science subject knowledge (experiment design, data analysis), and understanding of Universal Design for Learning (UDL) principles
context.additional_context: Pre-service teachers conduct PBL projects using digital tools (interactive whiteboards, accessibility software) to support students with disabilities in scientific inquiry processes (measurement, observation, evidence collection).

learning_goals: Evaluate the ability to design scientific inquiry activities (observation, hypothesis formulation, variable control) tailored to the learning needs of students with disabilities.
Develop and implement three inclusive science education strategies using digital tools (sensors, simulation software, etc.).
Propose at least two collaborative strategies with peer teachers to support scientific analysis skills for students with disabilities.
difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
